title: 110_s481
content: The "Tribal Colleges and Universities Faculty Loan Forgiveness Act" allows for loan repayment or cancellation for individuals teaching in tribal colleges or universities. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include full-time faculty members at Tribal Colleges or Universities for Perkins Loan forgiveness. Effective for service from academic year 2005-2006 onwards. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include full-time faculty members at Tribal Colleges or Universities for Perkins Loan forgiveness starting from the academic year 2005-2006. Additionally, Part G of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include provisions for FFEL and Direct Loans. Loan repayment or cancellation is available for individuals who teach at Tribal Colleges or Universities under Section 493C. The Secretary will carry out a program to assume or cancel loan repayment obligations for new full-time faculty members at Tribal Colleges or Universities who are not in default on their loans. The program will cover 15 percent of all loans made after the enactment of the Tribal Colleges and Universities Faculty Loan Forgiveness Act. The Tribal Colleges and Universities Faculty Loan Forgiveness Act offers loan repayment assistance to new full-time faculty members at Tribal Colleges or Universities. The program covers 15-30 percent of total loan amounts for the first to fifth year of employment, with a maximum repayment limit of $15,000 for loans under parts B and D. Consolidation loans may qualify for repayment assistance under certain conditions. The Secretary can issue regulations for loan forgiveness under the Tribal Colleges and Universities Faculty Loan Forgiveness Act. No refunding of loan repayments is allowed, and borrowers cannot receive benefits from both this program and another. The term 'year' refers to an academic year for faculty employment. When applied to employment as a faculty member, "year" means an academic year as defined by the Secretary. SEC. 3. Loan repayment for nursing instructors at tribal colleges or universities. Amends Section 846(a)(3) of the Public Health Service Act to include nursing instructors at tribally controlled colleges or universities. SEC. 4. Amounts forgiven not treated as gross income. Amounts forgiven under this Act will not be considered as gross income for federal tax purposes, in accordance with section 108(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
